result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Floyd Allen III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contact After Domestic Abuse Arrest [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to probation intake and provide DNA sample by 8/2/2022.
Probation Review Hearing in Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
Court WAIVES all non-mandatory court costs and fees.
Pay all mandatory supervision fees, court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during the period of probation. Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
Restitution set at ZERO.
Court advised that under 18 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and /or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

NO VIOLENT CONTACT with T.B. AFTER completing 50% of BIP classes and at the approval of the agent and victim.
No contact with firearms.

Batterers Intervention program.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Floyd Allen III

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edward Floyd Allen in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Josh Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing held.  
  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.

Defendant Edward Floyd Allen in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 35 via zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Edward Floyd Allen in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant does not qualify for PD representation. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case to allow defendant to retain private counsel. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (4/16/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.C.B. (dob 2/16/1989).
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Edward Floyd Allen in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 35.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Edward Floyd Allen III
Current: 1755 N Cambridge Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53202   (Effective: 04-14-2022)
Prior: 3217 North 12th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/14/22 @ 2p
